law.catch_line: Official misconduct in the second degree.

text.section:
A public servant is guilty of official misconduct in the second degree when he knowingly:
Commits an act relating to his office which constitutes an unauthorized exercise of his official functions; or
Refrains from performing a duty imposed upon him by law or clearly inherent in the nature of his office; or
Violates any statute or lawfully adopted rule or regulation relating to his office.
Official misconduct in the second degree is a Class B misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 188, effective January 1, 1975.
